name: 朴維鎮
objective: The purpose of this course is to train the students who can be familiar with the statistics approaches and theories. Besides, they will be able to employ the collected data to analyze the unknown environments. The course includes probability theory, testing, regression analysis and variance analysis.
schedule:
Week 1	Introduction to probability distribution, sampling distribution, and estimation
Week 2	Decision making for a single sample – Estimation, hypothesis testing, inference on the mean of a population
Week 3	Decision making for a single sample – Inference on the variance of a normal population, inference on a population proportion, goodness of fit test
Week 4	Decision making for two samples – Inference on the means of two populations, paired t-test
Week 5	Decision making for two samples – Inference on the ratio of variances of two normal populations, inference on two population proportions
Week 6	Simple linear regression – Part I
Week 7	Simple linear regression – Part II
Week 8	Other aspects of simple linear regression
Week 9	Midterm exam (In-Class, 1 Cheat Sheet, Calculator)
Week 10	Multiple linear regression – Part I
Week 11	Multiple linear regression – Part II
Week 12	Other aspects of multiple linear regression
Week 13	Factorial design, replication, center points – Part I
Week 14	Factorial design, replication, center points – Part II 
Week 15	Blocking, confounding, fractional factorial designs X-bar and R control chart
Week 16	Factorial experiments with more than two levels
Week 17	Introduction to control charts
Week 18	Final exam (In-Class, 1 Cheat sheet, Calculator)
scorePolicy:
1. Midterm Exam: 30%
2. Final Exam: 30%
3. Team project: 15%
4. Homework: 20%
5. Attendance: 5%
materials: Engineering Statistics (5th Ed., Wiley) by Montgomery, Runger, and Hubele (ISBN: 978-0-324-59433-1)
